Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since we last spoke?
Hi, Ellie. I’ve had some ups and downs, but I tried to implement some of the strategies we discussed.
That’s wonderful to hear! Can you share how that went for you?
Well, I practiced mindfulness in the mornings, and I started journaling. It felt good to put my thoughts down on paper.
That’s fantastic! How did you feel after journaling?
It was a bit freeing, I guess. I didn’t realize how much I was holding in until I wrote it all down.
That’s a significant realization. Did you notice any patterns or recurring themes in your journaling?
Yes, a lot of my worries revolve around my kids and my own feelings of inadequacy as a parent.
It’s insightful that you recognized that. Can you elaborate on what feelings of inadequacy you’re experiencing?
I just feel like I’m not doing enough for them, especially when I see their friends achieving things. I worry I’m holding them back somehow.
It’s common for parents to feel that way, especially when comparing themselves to others. Have you talked to your kids about their achievements and how they feel about their paths?
Not really. I guess I’ve been too focused on my own worries.
It might be helpful to shift the focus back to them. Celebrating their accomplishments, no matter how small, could help you both.
That’s a good point. I think I need to be more supportive rather than critical of myself.
Absolutely! Supporting them can also help alleviate some of your worries. How do you think they would respond to your encouragement?
I think they’d appreciate it. They’re good kids, and I know they want to make me proud.
That’s great to hear. Encouraging them can also strengthen your relationship. Have you noticed any changes in your mood since starting your mindfulness practice?
A little bit. I feel less overwhelmed sometimes, which is nice.
That’s an excellent improvement! It sounds like you’re starting to find a balance. What about during family gatherings? Were you able to set those boundaries we discussed?
I did! I took a few breaks during the gathering, which helped a lot.
That’s fantastic! It’s great to hear you were able to advocate for your needs. How did your family react to that?
They were understanding. I think they appreciated my honesty.
That’s a positive outcome! It sounds like you’re making strides in both your self-care and your relationships. What are your goals for our next session?
I want to continue working on my mindfulness practice and see if I can be more open with my kids about my feelings.
Those sound like excellent goals. I’m looking forward to hearing how that goes! Remember, it’s a process, and it’s okay to take small steps.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re doing the hard work, and I’m here to help. Take care of yourself, and I’ll see you next time!
Bye!
